member.name: MFMEDIASOURCE_CHARACTERISTICS
member.summary: Defines the characteristics of a media source. These flags are retrieved by the method.

member.name: MFMEDIASOURCE_CHARACTERISTICS.MFMEDIASOURCE_IS_LIVE
member.summary: This flag indicates a data source that runs constantly, such as a live presentation. If the source is stopped and then restarted, there will be a gap in the content.

member.name: MFMEDIASOURCE_CHARACTERISTICS.MFMEDIASOURCE_HAS_SLOW_SEEK
member.summary: The media source downloads content. It might take a long time to seek to parts of the content that have not been downloaded.

summary.para: The media source delivers a playlist, which might contain more than one entry. After the first playlist entry has completed, the media source signals the start of each new playlist entry by sending an MENewPresentation event. The event contains a presentation descriptor for the entry.
The media source can skip forward in the playlist. Applies only if the MFMEDIASOURCE_HAS_MULTIPLE_PRESENTATIONS flag is present.
The media source can skip backward in the playlist.
The media source is not currently using the network to receive the content. Networking hardware may enter a power saving state when this bit is set.
